property.value: A Muslim U.S. military chaplain praying in Afghanistan

note.text: Religion plays an important role in social life and custom in Afghanistan. Nearly all Afghans are Muslim. About three-quarters are Sunnis from the Hanafi branch of Sunni Islam. The remaining quarter are mostly Shia, including the Hazaras. Sufism, a belief in the mystical aspects of the Islamic religious experience, is widespread.
As of 2016, a few thousand Sikhs and Hindus remain in the country.
